1111616347056693248.text: 9/9 We are glad to have been backed by Consensys and some of the best angels who believed in us when no one else did. We are now one of the few breakout crypto products from India and are just getting started

1111616345559318529.text: 8/ By not opening up APIs and realising the bigger picture, banks have no idea what they are creating in the process. They are creating hungry and disenfranchised entrepreneurs who are now building the future of finance and banking. Not with the banks but despite them.

1111616343646703616.text: 7/ Today, Nuo enables users from around the world to transact with each other in a completely trustless way without any banking partner. This is a testament to the power of programmable and permission-less money. We are at no one's mercy anymore and create our own destiny.

1111616342241603591.text: 6/ Nuo was started with a vision to enable global cross border lending. Our goal was to enable borrowers from developing markets borrow at much lower interest rates by connecting them with lenders from developed markets who can earn a much higher return in the process.

1111616340538724352.text: 5/ It was hard for them to see what's in it for them and how much fees can they earn in the process. We were left with no option but to explore other ways to create these financial and credit products without any banking support.

1111616339053965312.text: 4/ Post BeeWise, we were working on a digital banking product by using traditional bank APIs and after over 9 months of running around, no bank was ready to provide us API access to create a financial product.

1111616337594351619.text: 3/ We were helping clients underwrite millions of new to credit customers who did not have a credit score. This is when we realised the whole credit cycle is broken and the problem was stemming from the top - the banks.

1111616336176635905.text: 2/ We started our fintech journey 4 years ago with BeeWise and through multiple pivots found a product market fit by creating an alternate data analytics SDK using financial data in SMS. We bypassed our way to this banking data with user consent without any dependency on banks.

1029643733334016000.text: 8/8 The one I missed: Now that the 2017 India opportunity of creating an exchange is lost & the ICO hype is over, we need to get back to building dapps instead. After all, we have been good at creating web 2.0 apps anyway. Let's not forgo the web 3.0 opportunity.

1029641501020573697.text: 7/ Debt will be rewritten: Debt has always been localised & opaque. There is a need to rewrite debt on the blockchain to make it borderless & transparent. http://lend.getnuo.com  is just the first step.

1029641395961716737.text: 6/ Decentralisation is a process: Not every dapp needs to be fully decentralised from day one. Lets get back to lean startup approach to figure out what the user wants by putting something out there.

1029641321839976449.text: 5/ Dapps vs Protocols: We believe in creating dapps which aren't dependent on protocols because in the long run there will be consolidation. Finding product market fit & scaling will be most valuable.

1029641239556050944.text: 4/ Blockchain is the worst database: Blockchain is the crappiest database ever invented which is good at just 2 things - immutability & consensus. Does your dapp need these? If not, use an SQL DB.

1029641142348865537.text: 3/ User need always trumps UX: We need to create dapps that weren't possible without a blockchain before. Users' need to use these products will trump UX difficulty that comes with decentralisation.

1029641049994489856.text: 2/ Not every app needs to be a dapp: As a developer before you get started, the fundamental question that you need to ask is: do I really need a blockchain?
